intro: Galium broterianum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The species is noted for its smooth, hairless appearance, which distinguishes it from other varieties within the Galium genus.
